message: http://www.scala-ide.org/ is this good for a scala beginner, i do have many years of java under my belt so i am not a true beginner in that sense i guess
I have used scala for a long time and although I am currently using it under eclipse (because of Java projects) I still use command line for most of the stuff.
What you need in scala (and let me be honest) any programming project is a tool to automate you most common task: compiling and running
sbt, ant, mvn, whatever fits your needs, that's what you use.
as a scala editor, eclipse is not that better than textmate, notepad++, intype, vim, emacs, etc..

I have usually found that emacs with sbt is the most productive development environment for me. Substitute <your editor> for emacs, but sbt is a really nice tool. I want the scala eclipse plugin to be my tool of choice and I'm sure it will get there. I'd suggest using it when it makes sense so you can give feedback to the developers to help it evolve.
